title: 112_s1592
content: The "Agricultural Credit Expansion Act" may be cited as the short title. Eligibility for farm loans is outlined in the act. The "Agricultural Credit Expansion Act" outlines eligibility requirements for farm ownership loans, including legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. The "Agricultural Credit Expansion Act" specifies eligibility criteria for farm ownership loans, including legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. It also includes special rules for determining eligibility of operating-only entities. The Secretary determines eligibility for family farm ownership based on ownership percentage exceeding 50%. Embedded entities must have at least 75% ownership by individuals who own the family farm. The eligibility requirements for family farm ownership are determined by the Secretary based on ownership percentage exceeding 50%. Embedded entities must have at least 75% ownership by individuals who own the family farm. Amendments are made to the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act regarding conservation loans and farm operating loans. Amendments are made to the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act regarding ownership eligibility for family farms, including the inclusion of limited liability companies and other legal entities as determined by the Secretary. Amendments to the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act include expanding ownership eligibility for family farms to include limited liability companies and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. Special rules are established for entities owned by other entities to meet ownership requirements. Additionally, changes are made to emergency loan provisions. Amendments to the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act expand ownership eligibility for family farms to include limited liability companies and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. Special rules are established for entities owned by other entities to meet ownership requirements. Changes are made to emergency loan provisions by modifying certain language in the proviso. Amendments to the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act broaden ownership eligibility for family farms to include limited liability companies and other legal entities as determined by the Secretary. Special rules are set for entities owned by other entities to meet ownership requirements. Changes are made to emergency loan provisions by adjusting specific language in the proviso. The Development Act is amended to change specific language regarding ownership eligibility for family farms, including the inclusion of limited liability companies and other legal entities as determined by the Secretary. Special rules are established for entities owned by other entities to meet ownership requirements. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include limited liability companies and other legal entities as determined by the Secretary for ownership eligibility of family farms. Special rules are established for entities owned by other entities to meet ownership requirements. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include limited liability companies and other legal entities for ownership eligibility of family farms. Special rules are established for entities owned by other entities to meet ownership requirements. Amendments include changes to joint operators and owners, as well as modifications to specific sections of the Act. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to allow refinancing of loans and repeal certain loan term limits. Loan term limits for direct loans are removed, and limitations on borrower eligibility for guaranteed assistance are revised.
